p: Estimating incidence rates for animal populations is generally difficult. Anderson and May [1992] used an experiment where susceptible mice were introduced into an infected population at a constant daily rate to estimate the transmission rate, and Mayberry et al. [2010] fitted domestic sheep and goats with GPS transmitters to monitor their contacts. But experiments like this are rare. More experimental data are needed to quantify contact rates in animals ( Stallknecht [2007]).
